name: Illuminant Map Analysis
description: Detects inconsistent illumination sources across image regions by estimating local color temperature maps.
algorithm: Physics-Based Illuminant Estimation for Forgery Detection
mechanism: Estimates local illuminant color using inverse-intensity chromaticity and generalized grayworld algorithms. Spliced regions from different lighting show inconsistent illuminant estimates.
parameters: Estimation: IIC + GGW, Superpixel: SLIC (k=200), Distance: angular, Clustering: k-means
source: Riess, C. & Angelopoulou, E. (2010) — Scene Illumination as an Indicator of Image Manipulation, IEEE WIFS
useCase: Detecting spliced regions by identifying inconsistent lighting conditions within a single image

references.title: Riess, C. & Angelopoulou, E. (2010) — Scene Illumination as an Indicator of Image Manipulation, IEEE WIFS

strengths:
• Physics-based approach
• Detects cross-image splicing
• Visualizable as color map
• Complementary to other methods
limitations:
• Assumes single illuminant per region
• Fails on complex multi-light scenes
• Requires sufficient color variance
• Sensitive to specular highlights
